source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時，佛在舍衛國祇陀林中給孤獨精舍，與大比丘眾千二百五十，菩薩萬人。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada's monastery in the Jeta's Grove of Śrāvastī with a large assembly of twelve hundred and fifty monks and ten thousand bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊如龍王視觀察大眾，觀大眾已，告諸菩薩：「仁者！
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān was like a dragon king who looks at the whole crowd and observes it, and then he addressed the bodhisattvas, "Gentlemen!

source_sentence: 誰能於後惡世，堪忍護持正法，以諸方便成就眾生？」
translation: Who will be able to tolerate the maintenance of the true dharma in a later evil age and accomplish the sentient beings with various skillful means?"

source_sentence: 爾時，彌勒菩薩即從坐起，偏袒右肩右膝著地，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, Maitreya then rose from his seat, bared his right shoulder and knelt on his right knee, and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我能堪忍於後世時，受持如來百千萬億那由他阿僧祇劫所集阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，多所利益無量眾生。」
translation: I can tolerate in later lifetimes the tathāgatas' collection of hundreds of thousands of trillions of incalculable eons of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment, and provide numerous benefits to measureless sentient beings."

source_sentence: 師子菩薩白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Shizi addressed the Buddha, saying, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我能堪忍成就眾生。」
translation: I can tolerate it and accomplish it for sentient beings."

source_sentence: 金剛菩薩白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The Vajra Bodhisattva said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我能堪忍憐愍守護諸惡眾生。」
translation: I can tolerantly pity and guard unwholesome sentient beings."

source_sentence: 文殊師利法王子白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Mañjuśrī, the Dharma Prince, said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我能堪忍充足眾生諸所悕望。」
translation: I can tolerate the longing of sentient beings."

source_sentence: 智勝菩薩白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The bodhisattva Jñānacandra said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我能堪忍令諸眾生除去無明。」
translation: I can tolerate it and cause sentient beings to get rid of ignorance."

source_sentence: 法勝菩薩白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The Dharmôdgata Bodhisattva said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我能堪忍令諸眾生離諸非法。」
translation: I can tolerate causing sentient beings to part with unlawful things."

source_sentence: 月勝菩薩白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Moonsault Bodhisattva said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我能堪忍令諸眾生常得遠離非功德法。」
translation: I can tolerate it so that sentient beings will always be free of things that aren't meritorious."

source_sentence: 日勝菩薩白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Risheng Pusa said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我能堪忍以安樂乘，令諸眾生皆得度脫。」
translation: I can tolerate the vehicle of well-being and cause all sentient beings to be liberated."

source_sentence: 無畏菩薩白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The fearless bodhisattva said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我能堪忍成就饒益無邊眾生。」
translation: I can tolerably achieve the benefit of limitless sentient beings."

source_sentence: 颰陀婆羅菩薩白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Bhadrapāla said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我能堪忍說無癡法，令諸眾生皆得聞知成就智慧。」
translation: I can tolerate speaking the teaching of nondeluded dharmas so that all sentient beings will hear and understand them and achieve wisdom."

source_sentence: 無盡意菩薩白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The Bodhisattva of Inexhaustible Wisdom said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我能堪忍興發大願，令無盡眾生皆得成就。」
translation: I can tolerantly give rise to the great vow that will cause endless sentient beings to attain it."

source_sentence: 月光菩薩言：「我能堪忍令諸眾生常行給事。」
translation: Moonlight Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate causing sentient beings to always perform useful tasks."

source_sentence: 妙目菩薩言：「我能堪忍與諸眾生安樂根本。」
translation: The Sudarśana Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate the root of the well-being of sentient beings."

source_sentence: 觀世音菩薩言：「我能堪忍剛強惡趣諸眾生等為作歸依。」
translation: Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate sentient beings in rigid and evil destinies as a refuge."

source_sentence: 得大勢菩薩言：「我能堪忍不度惡趣眾生皆令得度。」
translation: The Attainment of Great Strength Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate not saving sentient beings in bad destinies and making them save me."

source_sentence: 善數菩薩言：「我能堪忍令諸眾生不調伏者令得調伏。」
translation: The Bodhisattva of Skillful Numbers said, "I can tolerate bringing under submission those sentient beings who aren't under submission."

source_sentence: 妙意(丹云妙音)菩薩言：「我能堪忍喜樂小法諸眾生等令得度脫。」
translation: The Marvelous Mind (Tanyun Miaoyin) Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate delighting in lesser beings and causing them to be liberated."

source_sentence: 喜樂菩薩言：「我能堪忍卑下弊惡雜穢眾生皆令成就。」
translation: The Delightful Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate lowly, unwholesome, and defiled sentient beings and cause them to attain [liberation]."

source_sentence: 光積菩薩言：「我能堪忍成就解脫畜生眾生。」
translation: The Vairocana Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate the accomplishment of the liberation of sentient beings who are animals."

source_sentence: 入無諍菩薩言：「我能堪忍示現正道成就眾生。」
translation: The Bodhisattva of Entrance into No Struggle said, "I can tolerate the accomplishment of sentient beings who show the right path."

source_sentence: 愛見菩薩言：「我能堪忍安樂利益給施眾生求實智慧。」
translation: The Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate giving sentient beings the benefit of comfort and seeking true wisdom."

source_sentence: 不思議菩薩言：「我能堪忍愍念成就餓鬼眾生。」
translation: The Inconceivable Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate pity for the accomplishment of sentient beings who are hungry ghosts."

source_sentence: 日光菩薩言：「我能堪忍未淳熟眾生能令成熟。」
translation: The Sunbeam Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate sentient beings who are not yet ripe and bring them to maturity."

source_sentence: 毘摩羅鞊菩薩言：「我能堪忍充滿眾生一切所願。」
translation: The Bodhisattva Vimalākṣu said, "I can tolerate filling all the wishes of sentient beings."

source_sentence: 大氣力菩薩言：「我能堪忍為諸眾生閉惡道門。」
translation: The Bodhisattva of Great Empowerment said, "I can tolerate shutting the door of the evil path for sentient beings."

source_sentence: 斷疑菩薩言：「我能堪忍樂小法眾生令得度脫。」
translation: The Bodhisattva of Severing Doubt said, "I can tolerate delighting in sentient beings with lesser qualities and causing them to be liberated."

source_sentence: 住無畏菩薩言：「我能堪忍常以讚歎饒益眾生。」
translation: The Bodhisattva of Abiding Fearlessness said, "I can tolerate always praising and benefiting sentient beings."

source_sentence: 吉勝智菩薩言：「我能堪忍隨諸眾生種種所樂而度脫之。」
translation: The Bodhisattva of Keśīnī said, "I can tolerate the various ways in which sentient beings are pleased and are liberated."

source_sentence: 住無量菩薩言：「我能堪忍為諸眾生說無為道。」
translation: The Bodhisattva Abiding in Limitlessness said, "I can tolerate teaching sentient beings the path to nothingness."

source_sentence: 住一切法無畏菩薩言：「我能堪忍樂種種乘諸眾生等，隨其所樂而能示現。」
translation: The Bodhisattva Abiding in the Fearlessness of All Dharmas said, "I can tolerate the delight of sentient beings of various vehicles and so forth, and I can show them whatever they delight in."

source_sentence: 妙意菩薩言：「我能堪忍常示眾生所喜樂事而成就之。」
translation: The Marvelous-Minded Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate always showing what's pleasing to sentient beings and accomplishing it."

source_sentence: 無垢炎菩薩言：「我能堪忍愛念眾生而為守護令得成就。」
translation: The Vimalakīrti Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate loving sentient beings and guard them so that they're accomplished."

source_sentence: 摩尼光菩薩言：「我能堪忍令諸眾生自識宿命。」
translation: Maṇi-bright Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate making sentient beings aware of their past lives."

source_sentence: 光德菩薩言：「我能堪忍而以正勤拔濟眾生。」
translation: The Luminous Virtue Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate right effort to rescue sentient beings."

source_sentence: 賢德菩薩言：「我能堪忍究竟斷除眾生苦惱。」
translation: The Goodness Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate the ultimate removal of the suffering and distress of sentient beings."

source_sentence: 寶手菩薩言：「我能堪忍以諸珍寶給施眾生令得安樂。」
translation: The Jewel-Armed Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate giving sentient beings treasures to bring them well-being."

source_sentence: 最勝意菩薩言：「我能堪忍貧窮眾生令離貧苦。」
translation: The Bodhisattva of Supreme Aspiration said, "I can tolerate poor sentient beings and free them from poverty and suffering."

source_sentence: 斷諸纏菩薩言：「我能堪忍令諸眾生常得遠離煩惱怖畏。」
translation: The Bodhisattva Who Severed the Bonds said, "I can tolerate causing sentient beings to always be free of affliction and fear."

source_sentence: 金剛光菩薩言：「我能堪忍為諸眾生示現正道。」
translation: The Vajraprabha Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate showing sentient beings the right path."

source_sentence: 現德色像菩薩言：「我能堪忍多求眾生隨其所求皆能給足。」
translation: The Bodhisattva Representing Virtuous Form said, "I can tolerate sentient beings who have many desires and can get whatever they seek."

source_sentence: 法出曜菩薩言：「我能堪忍常說清淨諸法之行。」
translation: The Dharmôdgata Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate the practice of always explaining the pure dharmas."

source_sentence: 金剛體菩薩言：「我能堪忍除諸眾生一切障礙。」
translation: The Vajrapāṇi Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate the removal of all obstacles from sentient beings."

source_sentence: 法益菩薩言：「我能堪忍常以正法度脫眾生。」
translation: The Dharmôkara Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate always liberating sentient beings with the right teaching."

source_sentence: 無少有(丹云少為)菩薩言：「我能堪忍為諸眾生滅除諸毒。」
translation: The Bodhisattva Nothing Less (Dan yun yi) said, "I can tolerate the elimination of poisons for sentient beings."

source_sentence: 月上菩薩言：「我能堪忍為諸眾生示現說法。」
translation: The moon-rising bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate showing and teaching sentient beings."

source_sentence: 師子意菩薩言：「我能堪忍常以法施饒益眾生。」
translation: Shizi-i said, "I can tolerate always bestowing the Dharma for the benefit of sentient beings."

source_sentence: 童(丹作童)子光菩薩言：「我能堪忍度卑下處諸眾生等。」
translation: The Boy (Dan as Boy) Light Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate saving sentient beings in humble places."

source_sentence: 佛功德菩薩言：「我能堪忍示現正道斷諸惡趣。」
translation: The Bodhisattva of Buddhaly Merit said, "I can tolerate showing the right path and ending bad destinies."

source_sentence: 金剛光菩薩言：「我能堪忍現身色像度脫眾生。」
translation: Vajraprabha Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate the manifestation of a body's appearance and liberate sentient beings."

source_sentence: 德吉勝菩薩言：「我能堪忍令損減眾生為作增益。」
translation: Tejisheng Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate causing the diminution of sentient beings to become gains."

source_sentence: 持勢菩薩言：「我能堪忍閉地獄門。」
translation: Dhṛtarāṣṭra Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate closing the gates of hell."

source_sentence: 持甘露菩薩言：「我能堪忍令諸眾生得度生死。」
translation: Dhṛtarāṣṭra Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate causing sentient beings to be liberated from birth and death."

source_sentence: 網明菩薩言：「我能堪忍為諸眾生常現光明滅一切結。」
translation: The Net of Luminosity Bodhisattva said, "I can tolerate the constant appearance of light that extinguishes all bonds for sentient beings."

source_sentence: 爾時，舍利弗聞諸菩薩作如是等成就眾生以自莊嚴，得未曾有，前白佛言：「未曾有也。
translation: When Śāriputra heard that the bodhisattvas had accomplished such an accomplishment for sentient beings to adorn themselves in a way that had never been done before, he said to the Buddha, "Never has it been done before.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是諸菩薩不可思議有大悲心，種種方便堅固精進而自莊嚴，乃至一切眾生不能沮壞、不能籌量、不能及逮、不能摧伏，所有光明不可障蔽。
translation: Such bodhisattvas have inconceivably great compassion and adorn themselves with various methods of resolute exertion, even if all sentient beings can't be discouraged, measured, grasped, or subdued, and their light can't be obstructed.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我常稱讚是諸菩薩未曾有事，所謂有人，故從求索頭、目、耳、鼻、身體手足一切諸物，求索之時無所悋惜，不生悔心。
translation: I always praise those bodhisattvas who have never had anything, that is, someone, to ask for everything from the head, eyes, ears, nose, body, hands, and feet, and when they ask for them, they don't bother and don't become regretful.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我常思惟每作是念，或有逼迫是諸菩薩，從其求索若內、若外所有諸物，當知皆是住不思議解脫菩薩。」
translation: I always think about this every time I think, "Suppose there are bodhisattvas who are pressured into seeking whatever is inside or whatever is outside, and you know that they are all bodhisattvas who abide in inconceivable liberation."

source_sentence: 佛告舍利弗：「如是！
translation: The Buddha told Śāriputra, "So it is!

source_sentence: 如是！
translation: So it is!

source_sentence: 如汝所言。
translation: As you say.

source_sentence: 此諸菩薩所有禪定方便智慧境界之事，非諸凡夫一切聲聞及辟支佛所能思量。
translation: These things in the realm of the bodhisattvas' skillful means of meditation and wisdom are beyond the ability of ordinary people, śrāvakas, and pratyekabuddhas to fathom.

source_sentence: 「又，舍利弗！
translation: "And, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 是諸菩薩雖見諸佛神通變化，而於諸法心不動轉，常滿眾生諸所欲願。
translation: Although bodhisattvas see the transformations of the buddhas' supernormal powers, their minds aren't distracted by the teachings, and they always fulfill the wishes of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 「又，舍利弗！
translation: "Again, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 若有眾生樂居士法，現居士形為成就故。
translation: "If there are sentient beings who delight in the teaching of a householder, they take on the form of a householder for the sake of accomplishing it.

source_sentence: 若有眾生樂大威勢，現作諸王有大威力而調伏之。
translation: If there are sentient beings who delight in great authority, they'll be manifested as kings with great power and subdue them.

source_sentence: 若有眾生志求涅槃，以聲聞乘而度脫之。
translation: If there are sentient beings who aspire to nirvāṇa, they are liberated by the vehicle of the śrāvakas.

source_sentence: 求辟支佛者現辟支佛形，為度脫故。
translation: Those who seek the solitary buddha will take on the form of a solitary buddha for the purpose of liberating them.

source_sentence: 求大乘道者現作佛身，為建諸佛法故。
translation: Those who seek the great vehicle path will take on the form of a buddha for the purpose of building up the buddha-teachings.

source_sentence: 「如是，舍利弗！
translation: "So it is, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 是諸菩薩種種方便成就眾生，皆悉令得住於佛法。
translation: These bodhisattvas accomplish all sentient beings with various methods, and they all attain abiding in the Buddha-dharma.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 舍利弗！
translation: Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 若除如來智慧，更無餘乘而得度脫到於涅槃，以是義故名為如來。
translation: If there were no other vehicle besides the wisdom of the Tathāgata that leads to liberation and arrives at nirvāṇa, that's why it's called the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 如如來說如如之法，即如覺知此法，名為如來；知諸眾生種種欲樂而悉示現，名為如來；成就一切諸善根本，斷於一切不善根本，名為如來；能示眾生解脫之道，名為如來；能令眾生遠離邪道示現聖道，名為如來；說諸空法顯現空義，名為如來；一切眾生有種種識種種欲樂，隨其所樂示解脫道，名為如來。
translation: Thus the Tathāgata explains the teaching as it is, that is, he perceives and knows the teaching as it is, and he knows and fully shows the various desires and pleasures of sentient beings, and that's called the Tathāgata; he accomplishes all good roots and ends all unskillful roots, and that's called the Tathāgata; he shows sentient beings the way to their liberation, and that's called the Tathāgata; he causes sentient beings to avoid wrong paths and shows the noble path, and that's called the Tathāgata; he explains the teaching of emptiness and shows the meaning of emptiness, and he shows that all sentient beings have various consciousnesses and various desires, and he shows them the way to their liberation according to their desires, and that's called the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 諸凡夫等妄想疑惑，能使覺知非真實法，諸菩薩等於諸法界不生動轉，如幻眾生皆令解脫，次第當到趣於道場。
translation: Ordinary people with deluded conceptions and doubts are made to realize what's not really there, bodhisattvas and others are unmoving in the Dharma realm, and sentient beings who are illusory are all made to be liberated and will arrive at the site of the path in order.

source_sentence: 「又，舍利弗！
translation: "Again, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 在家菩薩應修二施。
translation: Laymen bodhisattvas should cultivate two kinds of generosity.

source_sentence: 云何為二？
translation: What are the two?

source_sentence: 一者、財施；二者、法施。
translation: One is giving of goods, and the other is giving of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 「又，舍利弗！
translation: "Again, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 出家菩薩柔和無瞋，應修四施。
translation: Renunciant bodhisattvas who are gentle and non-angry should cultivate four kinds of generosity.

source_sentence: 何等為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者、紙；二者、墨；三者、筆；四者、法。
translation: One, paper; two, ink; three, a pen; and four, the Dharma.

source_sentence: 如是四施，出家之人所應修行。
translation: These are the four kinds of almsgiving that renunciant monks should cultivate.

source_sentence: 得無生忍諸菩薩等，當應修習三種布施。
translation: Bodhisattvas who have attained the patience of nonproduction should cultivate three kinds of generosity.

source_sentence: 何等為三？
translation: What are the three?

source_sentence: 王位布施、妻子布施、頭目布施，如是三種名為大施名極妙施，得無生忍諸菩薩等，應修如是三種布施。」
translation: Giving to the king's throne, giving to wives, and giving to heads and eyes are three things called great and marvelous gifts, and bodhisattvas who have attained the patient acceptance of nonarising should cultivate these three kinds of giving."

source_sentence: 舍利弗白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Śāriputra said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 菩薩不應畏欲恚癡？」
translation: Shouldn't bodhisattvas be afraid of desire, ill-will, and delusion?"

source_sentence: 佛告舍利弗：「菩薩有二大犯。
translation: The Buddha told Śāriputra, "There are two major offenses committed by bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 何等為二？
translation: What are the two?

source_sentence: 因於瞋恚愚癡犯戒名為大犯，因欲犯者名為小犯，難得除却。
translation: Violating the precepts because of anger, ill-will, and folly is called a major violation, and violating them because of desire is called a minor violation that's difficult to get rid of.

source_sentence: 因瞋犯者名為大犯，易可除却；因癡犯者亦名大犯，亦難除却。
translation: An offense committed because of anger is called a major offense that's easy to get rid of, and an offense committed because of delusion is also called a major offense that's also difficult to get rid of.

source_sentence: 以何等故，愛為小犯難得除却？
translation: What is the reason why it's so difficult to get rid of a minor offense that's craving?

source_sentence: 愛能增長生死枝條亦為種子，以是義故小而難却。
translation: Love grows the branches of birth-and-death and also serves as seeds; because of this meaning, it's small but difficult to get rid of.

source_sentence: 因瞋犯者墮於地獄、畜生、惡道，速疾能為心作障礙，易得除却；因癡犯者墮八大地獄諸大苦處，難可解脫。

translation: "Thus, in all the worlds where the buddhas and world-honored ones are always present, may the world-honored ones have compassion on me and remember that if I were to commit many sins in this life or in any previous life, since beginningless birth and death, whether I did it myself, taught others to do it, or saw it done and followed it.

translation: The hindrances of sins that are created, whether covered or not, should lead to hell, hungry ghosts, animals, other evil destinies, marginal degradation, and the chariot of Maitreya, and the hindrances of sins created in these places are now all repented of.

translation: "Again, I'll go before the world-honored ones and say, 'If I've practiced almsgiving or observed pure precepts in this life or any other life, even given a peck of food to an animal, or cultivated all the good roots of pure practices, all the good roots of accomplishing sentient beings, all the good roots of cultivating bodhi, and all the good roots of unsurpassed knowledge, I will collectively calculate and count them all and return them all to unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment, just as I've returned them in the past, future, and present.'

source_sentence: 「眾罪皆懺悔，　　諸福盡隨喜，　及請佛功德，　　願成無上智。
translation: "Repenting all sins and rejoicing in all merits, I invite the Buddha's merits and vow to achieve unsurpassed knowledge.

source_sentence: 去來現在佛，　　於眾生最勝，　無量功德海，　　歸依合掌禮。
translation: The buddhas of the past and future present are the most excellent among sentient beings, and they have measureless oceans of merit, so they bow with folded hands in homage.

translation: Thus, a bodhisattva observes these thirty-five buddhas as they are in his presence, contemplates on all the merits of the Tathāgata, and makes such pure repentance.

source_sentence: 菩薩若能淨此罪已，爾時諸佛為其現身，為度眾生亦說種種諸行，成就愚惑諸眾生故。
translation: If a bodhisattva can purify this sin, then the buddhas will present themselves for him, teach various practices to save sentient beings, and accomplish the success of deluded sentient beings.

source_sentence: 菩薩於諸法界心不動搖，而諸眾生等有種種欲樂，隨其所樂皆能度脫滿其所願。
translation: While the bodhisattva's mind isn't shaken in the Dharma realm, sentient beings with various desires and pleasures can be liberated according to their desires and fulfill their vows.

source_sentence: 菩薩若入大悲三昧，能示現入地獄、畜生諸餘惡道；菩薩若入大莊嚴三昧，現居士身成就眾生；菩薩若入妙勝三昧，能現轉輪王身成就眾生；菩薩若入晃曜三昧，能現釋梵上妙色身成就眾生；菩薩若入一心三昧，現聲聞形成就眾生；菩薩若入清淨不二三昧，現辟支佛形成就眾生；菩薩若入寂靜三昧，能示佛身成就眾生；菩薩若入諸法自在三昧，隨諸眾生種種欲樂，現種種形而成就之。
translation: 菩薩若入大悲三昧，能示現入地獄、畜生諸餘惡道；菩薩若入大莊嚴三昧，現居士身成就眾生；菩薩若入妙勝三昧，能現轉輪王身成就眾生；菩薩若入晃曜三昧，能現釋梵上妙色身成就眾生；菩薩若入一心三昧，現聲聞形成就眾生；菩薩若入清淨不二三昧，現辟支佛形成就眾生；菩薩若入寂靜三昧，能示佛身成就眾生；菩薩若入諸法自在三昧，隨諸眾生種種欲樂，現種種形而成就之。

source_sentence: 「又彼菩薩或現釋身，或現梵身，或時示現轉輪王身，皆為成就諸眾生故，然此菩薩於諸法界而不動轉。
translation: "Furthermore, while that bodhisattva may present the body of the Buddha, the body of Brahmā, or the body of the wheel-turning king at times, all for the purpose of accomplishing sentient beings, this bodhisattva doesn't budge in the Dharma realm.

translation: The strength of a bodhisattva's courageous mind and good roots, the knowledge that he's freed from all sins, and the attainment of samādhi are not things that all sentient beings, śrāvakas, and pratyekbuddhas can do to get rid of their sins and regrets.

source_sentence: 菩薩若能稱彼諸佛所有名號，常於晝夜行三事者，得離犯罪及諸憂悔并得三昧。」
translation: If a bodhisattva can call on the names of those buddhas and always perform three deeds by day and night, he'll be freed from sins and regrets and attain concentration."

translation: Upāli then rose from his meditative concentration and went to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 到已，頭面禮足，却坐一面，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: When he arrived, he bowed his head and feet, withdrew to sit at one side, and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 向於靜處獨坐思惟，生如是念：『如來說此波羅提木叉清淨之戒，應當善學，為聲聞緣覺菩薩乘故說如是言，寧捨身命不捨於戒。』
translation: Sitting alone in a quiet place, he reflected and had this thought, 'The Tathāgata says that these pure precepts of prātimokṣa should be well studied, and he says this for the vehicle of the śrāvakas, pratyekbuddhas, who would rather sacrifice their lives than the precepts.'

source_sentence: 世尊！

translation: If the Buddha were alive and after his nirvāṇa, what would be called a śrāvaka human prātimokṣa?

source_sentence: 云何名為菩薩乘人波羅提木叉？
translation: "What is called the bodhisattva vehicle human prātimokṣa?

translation: The Bhagavān says that I'm the best among vinaya adherents, so how will I explain it in detail for others?

source_sentence: 今從世尊面聞受持逮無所畏，然後能為他人廣說。
translation: Now, having heard from the Bhagavān personally and received his teaching, I've acquired no fear, and then I'll be able to explain it in detail for others.

source_sentence: 我於靜處獨坐思惟生如是念：『我今應當詣世尊所，問比尼中決定之義。』
translation: Sitting alone in a quiet place, I reflected and had this thought, 'Now, I should go to the Bhagavān and ask him about the meaning of certainty in the Vinaya.'

source_sentence: 今此大眾諸菩薩等，及比丘僧悉皆集會。

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告優波離：「汝今當知，聲聞乘人有異方便、有異深心持清淨戒；菩薩乘人有異方便、有異深心持清淨戒。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Upāli, "Now, you should know that people in the śrāvaka vehicle have different methods and different profound minds for upholding the pure precepts, and people in the bodhisattva vehicle have different methods and different profound minds for upholding the pure precepts.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 聲聞乘人有異方便、有異深心；菩薩乘人有異方便、有異深心。
translation: śrāvaka vehicle people have different skillful means and different profound thoughts, and bodhisattva vehicle people have different skillful means and different profound thoughts.

source_sentence: 優波離！
translation: Upāli!

source_sentence: 聲聞乘人雖淨持戒，於菩薩乘不名淨戒；菩薩乘人雖淨持戒，於聲聞乘不名淨戒。
translation: Although a person in the śrāvaka vehicle may observe the precepts with purity, it's not called the pure precepts in the bodhisattva vehicle, and although a person in the bodhisattva vehicle may observe the precepts with purity, it's not called the pure precepts in the śrāvaka vehicle.

source_sentence: 優波離！
translation: Upāli!

source_sentence: 云何名為聲聞乘人雖淨持戒，於菩薩乘不名淨戒？
translation: "What is the term for a person in the śrāvaka vehicle who purifies the observance of precepts but doesn't call it purifying precepts in the bodhisattva vehicle?

source_sentence: 優波離！
translation: Upāli!

source_sentence: 聲聞乘人不應乃至起於一念欲更受身，是則名為聲聞乘人清淨持戒，於菩薩乘最大破戒名不清淨。
translation: "A person in the śrāvaka vehicle shouldn't even give rise to a single thought about wanting to receive another body, which is called a śrāvaka vehicle person who purely observes the precepts and a bodhisattva vehicle person who breaks the greatest precepts and is called not pure.

source_sentence: 云何名為菩薩乘人雖淨持戒，於聲聞乘不名淨戒？
translation: How is it called a person in the bodhisattva vehicle who purely observes the precepts but doesn't name them pure in the śrāvaka vehicle?

source_sentence: 優波離！
translation: Upāli!

source_sentence: 菩薩乘人於無量劫，堪忍受身不生厭患，是則名為菩薩乘人清淨持戒，於聲聞乘人最大破戒不名清淨。
translation: A person in the bodhisattva vehicle who tolerates body without becoming disillusioned for an immeasurable number of eons is called a person in the bodhisattva vehicle who purely observes the precepts, whereas a person in the śrāvaka vehicle who breaks the greatest precepts isn't called pure.

source_sentence: 「又，優波離！
translation: "Furthermore, Upāli!

source_sentence: 菩薩乘人持不盡護戒，聲聞乘人持盡護戒；菩薩乘人持開通戒，聲聞乘人持不開通戒；菩薩乘人持深入戒，聲聞乘人持次第戒。
translation: A person of the bodhisattva vehicle observes the inexhaustible guard precepts, while a person of the śrāvaka vehicle observes the exhaustive guard precepts; a person of the bodhisattva vehicle observes the enlightened precepts, while a person of the śrāvaka vehicle observes the unenlightened precepts; a person of the bodhisattva vehicle observes the in-depth precepts, while a person of the śrāvaka vehicle observes the sequential precepts.

source_sentence: 優波離！
translation: Upāli!

source_sentence: 云何名為菩薩乘人持不盡護戒，聲聞乘人持盡護戒？
translation: "What is called a person in the bodhisattva vehicle who upholds inexhaustible protection of the precepts and a person in the śrāvaka vehicle who upholds inexhaustible protection of the precepts?

source_sentence: 菩薩乘人持戒之時，於諸眾生及與他人應當隨順；聲聞乘人不應隨順。
translation: When a person in the bodhisattva vehicle observes the precepts, he should obey them with respect to sentient beings and others; a person in the śrāvaka vehicle should not obey them.

source_sentence: 優波離！
translation: Upāli!

source_sentence: 以是義故，菩薩乘人持不盡護戒，聲聞乘人持盡護戒。
translation: For this reason, people in the bodhisattva vehicle maintain inexhaustible protections for the precepts, and people in the śrāvaka vehicle maintain exhaustive protections for the precepts.

source_sentence: 「優波離！
translation: "Upāli!

source_sentence: 云何名為菩薩乘人持開通戒，聲聞乘人持不開通戒？
translation: "What is called a person in the bodhisattva vehicle who observes the enlightened precepts and a person in the śrāvaka vehicle who observes the unenlightened precepts?

source_sentence: 優波離！
translation: Upāli!

source_sentence: 菩薩乘人，以日初分有所犯戒，於日中分思惟當得一切種智，菩薩爾時不破戒身；以日中分有所犯戒，於日後分思惟當得一切種智，菩薩爾時不破戒身。
translation: "When a person in the bodhisattva vehicle violates the precepts at the beginning of the day and contemplates that he will attain all-inclusive knowledge at the middle of the day, the bodhisattva doesn't break the precepts; when he violates the precepts at the middle of the day and contemplates that he will attain all-inclusive knowledge at the latter part of the day, the bodhisattva doesn't break the precepts.

source_sentence: 以日後分有所犯戒，於夜初分思惟當得一切種智，菩薩爾時不破戒身。
translation: When he violates the precepts in the latter part of the day and contemplates that he will attain all-inclusive knowledge in the early part of the night, the bodhisattva doesn't break the body of the precepts at that point.

source_sentence: 以夜初分有所犯戒，於夜中分思惟當得一切種智，菩薩爾時不破戒身。
translation: When he violates the precepts in the first part of the night and contemplates that he will attain all-inclusive knowledge in the middle part of the night, the bodhisattva doesn't break the body of the precepts.

source_sentence: 以夜中分有所犯戒，於夜後分思惟當得一切種智，菩薩爾時不破戒身。
translation: When he violates the precepts in the middle part of the night and contemplates that he will attain all-inclusive knowledge in the latter part of the night, the bodhisattva doesn't break the precepts themselves at that point.

source_sentence: 以夜後分有所犯戒，於日初分思惟當得一切種智，菩薩爾時不破戒身。
translation: When he violates the precepts in the latter part of the night and contemplates that he will attain all-inclusive knowledge in the early part of the day, the bodhisattva doesn't break the body of the precepts at that time.

source_sentence: 以是義故，菩薩乘人持開通戒，聲聞乘人持不開通戒，菩薩不應生大慚愧，亦復不應生於悔纏。
translation: Because of this, a person of the bodhisattva vehicle who observes the liberating precepts and a person of the śrāvaka vehicle who observes the non-penetrating precepts shouldn't become greatly ashamed, and the bodhisattva shouldn't be tethered by remorse.

source_sentence: 優波離！
translation: Upāli!

source_sentence: 聲聞乘人數數犯罪，即時破失聲聞戒身。
translation: śrāvaka vehicle people repeatedly commit crimes, and they immediately lose their śrāvaka morality.

source_sentence: 聲聞乘人應當持戒斷一切結如救頭燃，所有深心為涅槃故。
translation: śrāvaka riders should observe precepts, cutting all bonds like saving a burning head, and have a deep intention for nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 優波離！
translation: Upāli!

source_sentence: 以是義故，聲聞乘人名持不開通戒。
translation: For this reason, śrāvaka vehicle people are called adherents of the unenlightened precepts.

source_sentence: 「優波離！
translation: "Upāli!

source_sentence: 云何菩薩乘人持深入戒，聲聞乘人持次第戒？
translation: "How do people in the bodhisattva vehicle observe the in-depth precepts and people in the śrāvaka vehicle observe the secondary precepts?

source_sentence: 菩薩乘人於恒河沙劫，受五欲樂遊戲自在，受諸樂已，未曾捐捨發菩提心，菩薩爾時不名失戒。
translation: When a person in the bodhisattva vehicle enjoys the five pleasures with ease for an eon as vast as the sands of the Ganges, and after experiencing those pleasures, he hasn't abandoned them and aroused the mind of enlightenment, the bodhisattva isn't said to have lost the precepts at that point.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 菩薩乘人有於後時，善能護持菩提之心，乃至夢中一切結使不為其患。
translation: "At some point later in life, a person in the bodhisattva vehicle well guards the mind of enlightenment, even to the point where all the bonds in a dream aren't a problem for him.

source_sentence: 菩薩乘人不應一時於一身中盡一切結，應當漸漸盡一切結，善根成就非不成熟；聲聞乘人如救頭然，乃至一念受身不應生喜。
translation: Instead of ending all the bonds in one person at once, a bodhisattva-vehicle person should gradually end all the bonds, and their good roots will be accomplished, not immature, while an śrāvaka-vehicle person acts like a head saver, so even a single thought of feeling the body shouldn't give rise to joy.

source_sentence: 以是義故，大乘之人持深入戒，聲聞乘人持次第戒。
translation: For this reason, a person of the great vehicle observes the deeply penetrating precepts, and a person of the śrāvaka vehicle observes the sequential precepts.

source_sentence: 菩薩乘人持開通戒、持不盡護戒，聲聞乘人持不開通戒、持盡護戒。
translation: Those in the bodhisattva vehicle observe the well-established precepts and the inexhaustible guard precepts, while those in the śrāvaka vehicle observe the unenlightened precepts and the inexhaustible guard precepts.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 阿耨多羅三藐三菩提甚為難得，具大莊嚴乃可得成。
translation: Anuttarasamyak-saṃbodhi is very difficult to attain and can only be achieved with great adornment.

source_sentence: 大乘之人於無量劫往來生死，不應生於厭離之心。
translation: A great vehicle person shouldn't become disillusioned with birth and death over measureless eons.

source_sentence: 「優波離！
translation: "Upāli!

source_sentence: 如來觀察籌量，為大乘人不應一向說厭離法，不應一向說離欲法，不應一向說速疾法。
translation: The Tathāgata observes and measures that for great vehicle people, he shouldn't always teach the Dharma of disillusionment, shouldn't always teach the Dharma of freedom from desire, and shouldn't always teach the Dharma of speediness.

source_sentence: 常當為說發歡喜心相應諸法，常應為說甚深無難無悔纏法，常應為說無聚無礙空無之法。
translation: They should always teach the Dharma associated with the arousal of joyful thoughts, always teach the Dharma that's profound, without difficulty or the tethers of regret, and always teach the Dharma that's without lumps or obstructions, empty, or nonexistent.

source_sentence: 聞此法已，常樂生死不生憂悔，亦能滿足菩提之行。」
translation: After hearing this teaching, they'll always be happy with birth and death and won't become sad and regretful, and they'll be able to fulfill the practice of enlightenment."

source_sentence: 優波離白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Upāli said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 或有欲相應心而犯於戒，或有瞋相應心而犯於戒，或有癡相應心而犯於戒。
translation: Perhaps there's a mind associated with desire that violates the precepts, an attitude associated with anger that violates the precepts, or a mind associated with delusion that violates the precepts.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 菩薩犯戒，於欲相應心、瞋相應心、癡相應心，何者為重？」
translation: When a bodhisattva violates the precepts, which is more serious: the mind associated with desire, the mind associated with anger, or the mind associated with delusion?"

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告優波離：「若有菩薩如恒河沙欲相應心而犯於戒，或有菩薩因一瞋心而犯於戒，等住菩薩大乘之道，因瞋犯者當知最重。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Upāli, "If a bodhisattva violates the precepts with a mind associated with the desire of the Ganges, or if a bodhisattva violates the precepts because of a single angry thought, then the bodhisattva who is equally established on the great vehicle path should know that violating them because of anger is the most serious.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 因瞋恚故能捨眾生，因貪欲故於諸眾生而生親愛。
translation: Because of anger, they're able to abandon sentient beings, and because of their desire, they become attached to sentient beings.

source_sentence: 優波離！
translation: Upāli!

source_sentence: 所有諸結能生親愛，菩薩於此不應生畏，所有諸結能捨眾生，菩薩於此應生大畏。
translation: All the bonds that create affection should not cause a bodhisattva to fear, and all the bonds that free sentient beings should cause a bodhisattva to have great fear.

source_sentence: 「優波離！
translation: "Upāli!

source_sentence: 如來先說欲難捨離為小犯，瞋易得離名為大犯。
translation: The Tathāgata first said that a minor infraction is one in which it's difficult to part with desire, and a major infraction is one in which it's easy to part with anger.

source_sentence: 優波離！
translation: Upāli!

source_sentence: 所有諸結犯小難離，大乘之人應當忍受，所有諸結犯大易離，大乘之人乃至夢中不應忍受。
translation: All the minor infractions of the bonds that are difficult to escape from should be tolerated by a great vehicle person, and all the major infractions of the bonds that are easy to escape from should not be tolerated by a great vehicle person, even in a dream.

source_sentence: 以是義故，大乘之人因欲犯者，我說是人不名為犯，因瞋犯者我說是人名為大犯，名大過患、名大墮落，於佛法中是大留難。
translation: For this reason, when a great vehicle person violates them out of desire, I say that person isn't called a violator, and when they violate them out of anger, I say that person is called a great violator, which is called a great misdeed and a great fall, and it's a great difficulty in the Buddhist teaching.

source_sentence: 優波離！
translation: Upāli!

source_sentence: 若有菩薩無有方便，欲相應心而犯於戒生於怖畏，於瞋犯戒不生怖畏。
translation: If there are bodhisattvas who don't have the skillful means to violate the precepts with a mind concomitant with desire, fear arises when they violate the precepts with anger, and fear doesn't arise when they violate the precepts with anger.

source_sentence: 若有菩薩而有方便，恚相應心而犯於戒生於怖畏，欲相應心而犯於戒不生怖畏。」
translation: If there are bodhisattvas who have skillful means, transgressing the precepts with a mind associated with anger produces fear, and transgressing the precepts with a mind associated with desire produces no fear."

source_sentence: 爾時，文殊師利在大眾中，前白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At the time, Mañjuśrī was in the crowd and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 一切諸法究竟比尼，誰受比尼？」
translation: Who receives the final confession of all dharmas?"

source_sentence: 佛告文殊：「若諸凡夫悉能了知，一切諸法究竟比尼，如來終不演說比尼。
translation: The Buddha told Mañjuśrī, "If ordinary people could fully understand the ultimate pīyan of all things, the Tathāgata would never expound the pīyan.

source_sentence: 以不知故，如來爾時為令覺知一切諸法究竟比尼，漸次為說諸比尼法。」
translation: Because they don't know it, the Tathāgata then gradually explained the words of the vinaya in order to make them aware of the ultimate vinaya of all things."

source_sentence: 爾時，優波離白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Upāli then said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此文殊師利於此解說比尼決定之義而無所說。」
translation: Here, Mañjuśrī explains the definitive meaning of the vinaya without saying anything."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告文殊師利：「汝今應當解說究竟比尼之法，此優波離欲得聞於比尼之義。」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Mañjuśrī, "Now, you should explain the ultimate vinaya teaching, and this Upāli wants to hear about the meaning of vinaya."

source_sentence: 爾時，文殊師利語優波離言：「一切諸法究竟無垢，能自調心乃能得見究竟比尼。
translation: It was then that Mañjuśrī spoke to Upāli, "All things are completely undefiled, and it's when you can tame your own mind that you'll be able to see the ultimate vinaya.

source_sentence: 一切諸法無有諸纏淨其本性，乃能得見究竟比尼。
translation: All things lacking entanglement are pure in their original nature, and it's then that one can see the ultimate pīnā.

source_sentence: 一切諸法無有染污我不可得，乃能得見無悔比尼。
translation: When all things lack defiled self and are unobtainable, then it's possible to see the vinaya of no regret.

source_sentence: 如如真實億萬法門欣樂修學，乃能得見清淨學戒。
translation: By joyfully cultivating a hundred million teachings as they really are, it's possible to see the pure training of precepts.

source_sentence: 一切諸法無有分別，無縛無解不作思惟，乃能得見無有縛著。
translation: When all things lack discrimination, lack bondage, lack understanding, and are not contemplated, then it's possible to see no bondage.

source_sentence: 一切諸法無住無染不作留住，乃能得見諸法清淨。
translation: When all dharmas are unstained and undefiled and don't remain, it's possible to see the purity of all dharmas.

source_sentence: 一切諸法住虛空際離諸處所，乃能得見所作清淨。
translation: When all dharmas abide in the realm of space and are free from locations, it's possible to see the purity of what's being done.

source_sentence: 一切諸法逮無鬪諍，前際後際不可得故，乃能得見三世平等。
translation: All dharmas are acquired without strife, and because the prior and subsequent periods are incomprehensible, it's possible to see the equality of the three times.

source_sentence: 一切諸法離諸施設心無所行，乃能得見斷於疑結。
translation: All things that are free of conceptualizations and mind have nothing to do, then it's possible to see the ending of the bond of doubt.

source_sentence: 優波離！
translation: Upāli!

source_sentence: 是則名為究竟比尼法界，諸佛世尊從此得道。
translation: This is called the ultimate vinaya dharma realm, from which the buddhas and world-honored ones attain the path.

source_sentence: 若能籌量觀察此法，是名善學逮最勝戒；若不觀此法，是則不名深入如來所學之戒。」
translation: If someone can contemplate this teaching, this is called skillfully learning and acquiring the most excellent precepts; if they don't contemplate this teaching, this is not called deeply penetrating the precepts that the Tathāgata has trained."

source_sentence: 爾時，優波離白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Upāli then said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此文殊師利所說之法，皆是不可思議。」
translation: The teachings taught by this Mañjuśrī are unfathomable."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告優波離：「文殊師利所說之法依於解脫，所依解脫心無去來。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Upāli, "The teaching given by Mañjuśrī relies on liberation, and the mind that relies on liberation has no going or coming.

source_sentence: 是故文殊師利說一切法心無去來，於心解脫生增上慢者，為除彼人增上慢故。」
translation: That's why Mañjuśrī teaches that the mind has no going or coming of all things, and he gives rise to pride in the mind's liberation in order to remove that person's pride in their superiority."

source_sentence: 爾時，優波離白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Upāli then said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 比丘行何法故名增上慢？」
translation: What does a monk do that's called pride in his spirituality?"

source_sentence: 佛告優波離：「若有比丘作是思惟欲斷貪欲名增上慢，作是思惟欲斷瞋恚名增上慢，作是思惟欲斷愚癡名增上慢。
translation: The Buddha told Upāli, "Suppose a monk contemplates this desire to end greed, which is called pride, contemplates this desire to end anger, which is called pride, and contemplates this desire to end foolishness, which is called pride.

source_sentence: 貪欲法異、諸佛法異，作是思惟名增上慢。
translation: When the law of desire is different and the laws of the buddhas are different, it's called arrogance to contemplate this.

source_sentence: 瞋恚法異、諸佛法異，作是思惟名增上慢。
translation: When the law of anger is different and the teachings of the buddhas are different, this is considered to be what's called pride in superiority.

source_sentence: 愚癡法異、諸佛法異，作是思惟名增上慢。
translation: When the law of foolishness is different and the teachings of the buddhas are different, to contemplate it that way is called arrogance.

source_sentence: 作是思惟見有所得名增上慢，作是思惟見有所證名增上慢，作是思惟見有解脫名增上慢，作是思惟見諸法空名增上慢，作是思惟見於無相名增上慢，作是思惟見於無作是名增上慢，作是思惟見有諸行名增上慢，作是思惟見有諸法名增上慢。
translation: To contemplate and see that there's attainment is called arrogance, to contemplate and see that there's realization is called arrogance, to contemplate and see that there's liberation is called arrogance, to contemplate and see the emptiness of things is called arrogance, to contemplate and see that there are no characteristics is called arrogance, to contemplate and see that there are no actions is called arrogance, to contemplate and see that there are things is called arrogance.

source_sentence: 一切諸法不可思議，作是思惟不應思議名增上慢。
translation: All dharmas are inconceivable, and to contemplate that they shouldn't be contemplated is called arrogance.

source_sentence: 諸法空無何用精進，作是思惟名增上慢。
translation: There's no need to exert effort when all things are empty, and it's called pride of superiority to contemplate in this way.

source_sentence: 是名聲聞住增上慢。
translation: This is called the śrāvakas' abiding in pride of superiority.

source_sentence: 「云何名為菩薩增上慢？
translation: "What is called the bodhisattvas' pride in their superiority?

source_sentence: 佛乘最勝作是思惟，我當於中發菩提心名增上慢。
translation: "The Buddha vehicle is the most excellent, and this is called arrogance when I think, 'I will give rise to the mind of enlightenment in this.'

source_sentence: 行六波羅蜜當得作佛，作是思惟名增上慢。
translation: Doing the six perfections will make me a buddha, and this is what I think, which is called arrogance.

source_sentence: 般若波羅蜜能得出離，更無餘法而得出離，作是思惟名增上慢。
translation: He thinks, 'The perfection of wisdom can lead to deliverance, and there's no other way to deliverance,' and that's called arrogance.

source_sentence: 於甚深法應作方便不因世法，作是思惟名增上慢。
translation: To contemplate that this is a method that should be applied to a profound teaching and not a worldly teaching is called arrogance.

source_sentence: 此法甚深、此非甚深，作是思惟名增上慢。
translation: This is a profound thing and this is not a profound thing, and to contemplate it in this way is called arrogance.

source_sentence: 此法是淨、此法非淨，作是思惟名增上慢。
translation: This teaching is pure, and this teaching is not pure, and to contemplate it this way is called arrogance.

source_sentence: 此是佛法、此是辟支佛法、此是聲聞法，作是思惟名增上慢。
translation: This is a Buddhist teaching, this is a pratyekabuddha teaching, and this is a śrāvaka teaching, and to contemplate them in this way is called being arrogant.

source_sentence: 此法應作、此法不應作，作是思惟名增上慢。
translation: This is a teaching that should be done, and this is a teaching that shouldn't be done, and to contemplate it this way is called arrogance.

source_sentence: 此是近法、此非近法，作是思惟名增上慢。
translation: This is a near teaching and this is not a near teaching, and to contemplate them in this way is called increasing conceit.

source_sentence: 此是正道、此是邪道，作是思惟名增上慢。
translation: This is the right path and this is the wrong path, and to contemplate it this way is called increasing arrogance.

source_sentence: 疾當得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，不疾當得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，作是思惟名增上慢。
translation: He'll quickly attain supreme perfect enlightenment and he'll not quickly attain supreme perfect enlightenment, and to contemplate this is called arrogance.

source_sentence: 一切佛法不可思議，未曾有人能覺之者，作是思惟名增上慢。
translation: All buddha-teachings are inconceivable, and no one has ever realized them, so to contemplate them this way is called contributory conceit.

source_sentence: 阿耨多羅三藐三菩提不可思議，彼不應思議，此非是見然是過患，是名菩薩住增上慢。」
translation: The fact that the unsurpassed, correct enlightenment shouldn't be considered and that this is not a view but a fault is called a bodhisattva abiding in arrogance."

source_sentence: 爾時，優波離白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Upāli then said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 云何比丘離增上慢？」
translation: How is a monk free of pride in his spiritual superiority?"

source_sentence: 佛告優波離：「若有比丘思惟諸心，思惟心時不著思惟，是名最勝離增上慢。」
translation: The Buddha told Upāli, "If a monk contemplates his thoughts and doesn't get attached to contemplating them when he contemplates them, this is called the most excellent person who's free of pride."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊欲廣分別思惟法故，而說偈言：「不應分別法非法，　　戲論諸心不應住，　不思議法而能知，　　名一切時受樂人。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān wanted to make a broad distinction between contemplating things and speaking in verse, "He shouldn't discriminate things that are not true, shouldn't abide in conceptualizing states of mind, and can know inconceivable things, which is called a person who enjoys all the time.

source_sentence: 若有欲知無有法，　　作是思惟非真實，　隨逐邪心凡夫人，　　受諸有苦百千億。
translation: If someone wants to know that there's no such thing, and they contemplate it as untrue, then they'll follow the mistaken thoughts of ordinary people and experience a hundred billion [ways] of suffering in existence.

source_sentence: 若有比丘常念佛，　　此則非真非正念，　當知佛從分別起，　　實不可取亦不生。
translation: If a monk always thinks of the Buddha, this is not true or correct mindfulness, and he should know that the Buddha arises from discrimination and is really neither desirable nor arisen.

source_sentence: 若有思惟諸空法，　　則住邪道凡夫人，　雖因名字說空法，　　而實無有名字說。
translation: If someone contemplates the teachings of emptiness, then they're a worldling who abides in a wrong path, even though they say the teaching of emptiness by name, but there really is no teaching by name.

source_sentence: 閑居寂靜思惟法，　　世所稱歎寂靜人，　心住覺觀是戲論，　　是故無思能解法。
translation: A person who lives in quiet contemplation of qualities, which is praised by the world as quiet, abides in mind, perceives and observes what's conceptual, and therefore doesn't think about things that can be understood.

source_sentence: 心心諸法名為思，　　若有所思必有著，　若能遠離是著法，　　於諸所思無復思。
translation: The mind and mental states are called thoughts, and if there's any thought, there must be attachment. If they can avoid such attachment, they won't think about what's thought again.

source_sentence: 法同草木無所知，　　而因諸緣得生起，　無有眾生而可得，　　能起空無諸緣法。
translation: Like grass and trees that know nothing, dharmas that arise because of conditions, there are no sentient beings to be attained, and they can give rise to dharmas that are empty and without conditions.

source_sentence: 因日光明眼得見，　　夜則不見離眾緣，　若眼自能見色者，　　何故無緣而不見？
translation: The eye can see because of the light of the sun, but at night it doesn't see apart from all the conditions, so if the eye can see form on its own, why wouldn't it see it without conditions?

source_sentence: 眼常因於諸光明，　　得見種種可意色，　當知見性眾緣生，　　是故知眼不能見。
translation: "The eye always sees various desirable forms because of the lights, and it should be known that the nature of views arises from many conditions; therefore, it's known that the eye can't see.

source_sentence: 若有所聞諸好聲，　　生已即滅無有聞，　推其去處不可得，　　因分別故起聲想。
translation: If there are pleasant sounds that are heard, they cease to be heard after being produced, and their place of departure is inaccessible, giving rise to the conception of sound because of discrimination.

source_sentence: 一切諸法同音聲，　　施設說有諸數相，　未曾能生法非法，　　為凡夫故而示現。
translation: All things that are sounds are the same, and they're described as having numerous characteristics, which are unproduced or unproduced by phenomena and are shown for the sake of ordinary people.

source_sentence: 我為世間歎布施，　　而實慳法不可得，　佛所說法難思議，　　雖不可得而演說。
translation: I praise generosity for the world, but the Dharma of stinginess is really unobtainable, and the Buddha's teaching is unfathomable, even though it's unobtainable.

source_sentence: 我常歎說持淨戒，　　破戒之相如執空，　諸破戒相如虛空，　　清淨持戒亦如是。
translation: I've always praised the observance of pure precepts, the characteristic of violating precepts is like clinging to emptiness, and the characteristic of violating precepts is like empty space; so is the pure observance of precepts.

source_sentence: 我說忍辱為妙勝，　　瞋恚之性實不生，　於諸法中無觸惱，　　而佛開示忍辱者。
translation: I say that forbearance is marvelous, that the nature of anger really doesn't arise, that there's no contact or vexation among dharmas, and that the Buddha reveals the character of forbearance.

source_sentence: 常說晝夜無疲倦，　　覺悟精進為最上，　雖復勤行於百劫，　　然其所作無增減。
translation: He always explains that day and night are not tiring, that awakening and effort are the highest, and that even though he's diligently practiced for a hundred eons, his work never increases or decreases.

source_sentence: 禪定解脫為最勝，　　如來開示說諸門，　而實諸法無散亂，　　世尊現說諸禪定。
translation: Meditation and liberation are the most excellent, and the Tathāgata reveals and explains the various approaches, yet truly these things are not distracted, and the Bhagavān now explains the meditations.

source_sentence: 智慧之性能覺了，　　能知諸法為慧人，　然其自性不有生，　　佛能示現為解說。
translation: A person of wisdom who perceives the properties of wisdom, a person of wisdom who knows all dharmas, yet their own nature doesn't arise, and the Buddha is able to show and explain it.

source_sentence: 我常歎說清苦法，　　歡喜樂行頭陀者，　推求貪法不可得，　　名為最上不貪者。
translation: I've always praised the Dharma of purifying suffering, and I've always praised the happy, joyful practitioners of the ascetic path who presume that the law of craving is unobtainable and are called the most excellent non-craver.

source_sentence: 常為眾生百千眾，　　現說地獄怖畏事，　未曾有去墮惡道，　　死入無間地獄者。
translation: He always teaches the fears of hell for a hundred thousand sentient beings, so there's no one who leaves and falls into a bad destiny or dies and enters an unremitting hell.

source_sentence: 無有能作地獄者，　　亦無能作鉾矟等，　因分別故而見有，　　刀劍之害傷己身。
translation: There's no one who can make hell, and there's no one who can make spears and so forth that are seen to exist because of discrimination, and that hurt themselves with swords and knives.

source_sentence: 雜色莊嚴花果樹，　　金色宮殿而晃曜，　彼亦未曾有作者，　　皆從妄想分別起。
translation: Ornamented flowering and fruit trees of various colors and shining golden palaces have never had an author, but they all arise from deluded conceptualization.

source_sentence: 虛偽之法誑世間，　　著想迴旋凡夫人，　於取不取無自性，　　猶如分別幻化炎。
translation: False dharmas can lead the world, and images circling ordinary people, grasping and not grasping have no essence, just like the illusory flames of discrimination and transformation.

source_sentence: 說於諸行最勝者，　　能為眾生發道心，　菩提之道不可得，　　當知求者亦非實。
translation: He teaches that the most excellent of all practices is the one who arouses the mind of the path for sentient beings, that the path to enlightenment is unobtainable, and that you should know that even those who seek it aren't real.

source_sentence: 其心本性常清淨，　　無有染著諸苦惱，　凡夫分別諸惡心，　　自生貪愛諸染著。
translation: The original nature of their minds is always pure, free of defiled attachment and suffering, whereas ordinary people discriminate between bad states of mind and generate their own cravings and defiled attachments.

source_sentence: 諸法妙勝常寂靜，　　而實無有愛恚癡，　法性解脫離染愛，　　逮到安隱無處所。
translation: The marvelous excellence of all dharmas is always quiescent, yet there's really no craving, ill-will, or delusion, and the Dharma nature is liberated from defiled craving, so they attain peace and nowhere.

source_sentence: 我知諸法如虛空，　　遊諸世間不生畏，　其意未曾有染著，　　是故不住於邪道。
translation: I know that all dharmas are like space, so I travel through the world without fear, and my mind has never been tainted with attachment; therefore, I don't abide in a wrong path.

source_sentence: 我於多劫修諸行，　　度脫無邊諸眾生，　而諸眾生生不盡，　　亦未曾有增減時。
translation: I've cultivated many eons of practice to liberate an unlimited number of sentient beings, yet their births never end, and there's never a time when they increase or decrease.

source_sentence: 譬如世有大幻師，　　能化無邊百千眾，　即時皆害諸化人，　　而於幻者無增損。
translation: Suppose there's a great illusionist in the world who can transform an infinite multitude of hundreds of thousands of people, and at once he harms those who transform him, but there's no increase or decrease in the illusionist.

source_sentence: 一切眾生如幻相，　　其邊未曾而可得，　若有能觀不思議，　　當知彼人不厭生。
translation: All sentient beings are illusory in appearance, and their limit has never been known, so if there's someone who can observe and doesn't deliberate, you should know that person isn't disillusioned with birth.

source_sentence: 觀世寂靜名勇猛，　　知法實相亦復然，　受五欲利當修行，　　不生染著度眾生。
translation: He observes the quiescence of the world and is called courageous, knowing the true nature of things to be likewise, cultivates the benefits of the five desires, and saves sentient beings without defiled attachment.

source_sentence: 無有眾生及壽命，　　世尊憐愍興慈悲，　勤修精進大苦行，　　雖無眾生作利益。
translation: There are no sentient beings or life spans, so the Bhagavān takes pity and arouses compassion, diligently cultivating great austerities even though there are no sentient beings to benefit.

source_sentence: 如以空捲誘小兒，　　誑惑其心令染著，　然後開手示空捲，　　小兒即時大啼哭。
translation: Like enticing a young child with an empty scroll that deceives his mind into defiled attachment, then opening your hand and showing him the scroll, the young child immediately cries out.

source_sentence: 如是難思佛世尊，　　於諸法相淨覺意，　已解遠離空無法，　　而能示現於世間。
translation: Thus, it's difficult to fathom that the Bhagavān, who has understood the characteristics of all things and has pure awareness, is free of emptiness and nonexistence, and yet he's able to show them to the world.

source_sentence: 於我法中甚可樂，　　捨離俗服能出家，　其後當得最勝果，　　大慈悲人之所說。
translation: He's very pleasant in my teaching, has abandoned worldly clothes, and can leave home, whereupon he'll attain the most excellent result, as explained by a greatly compassionate person.

source_sentence: 已能出家捨俗務，　　復聞當得逮諸果，　觀察諸法真實相，　　無有諸果而可得。
translation: Once he leaves home and leaves his mundane duties, he also hears that he'll attain the fruits, observing the true characteristics of dharmas, and that there are no fruits that can be attained.

source_sentence: 已於諸法無得果，　　轉復生於未曾有，　快哉大悲人師子，　　善入相應諸法相。
translation: Having already experienced the unattained results of all dharmas, he'll be reborn into something unprecedented.

source_sentence: 一切諸法如虛空，　　能立名字百千萬，　此名為根禪解脫，　　亦名為力七覺支。
translation: All dharmas are like space, and they can be designated by a hundred million names, which are called the liberation of the faculties and meditation and are also called the seven factors of awakening by force.

source_sentence: 諸根無有生滅相，　　覺力等法亦復然，　非是色性不可取，　　以智力現示世間。
translation: The faculties lack the marks of arising and ceasing, and so do the powers of awakening and other things that aren't form and nature but are ungraspable and are shown to the world by their power.

source_sentence: 我說眾生有所得，　　皆是遠離諸性相，　若有計我有所得，　　不名為得沙門果。
translation: I say that sentient beings who attain something are all free from the characteristics of their natures, and if there's any notion that I've attained something, it's not called attaining the ascetic fruit.

source_sentence: 若法無生亦無滅，　　誰有於中而得者？
translation: If things are neither produced nor ceased, who is there who attains them?

source_sentence: 說眾生得即無得，　　能覺此法名為得。
translation: To say that sentient beings attain is to say that they don't attain, and to be able to realize this teaching is called attaining.

source_sentence: 眾生得果名最勝，　　我說眾生非眾生，　未曾有得眾生者，　　是故不應有得果。
translation: The name of the fruit that sentient beings attain is most excellent, and I say that sentient beings are not sentient beings; there has never been a sentient being who has attained it, so there shouldn't be a fruit that's attained.

source_sentence: 譬如良田無種子，　　彼中不應而生牙，　如是眾生不可得，　　云何當有逮寂靜？
translation: It's like a good field with no seeds, in which teeth shouldn't arise; thus, sentient beings can't be attained, so how could there be arrested tranquility?

source_sentence: 一切眾生性寂靜，　　未曾有得其根本，　若有能觀此法者，　　我說永寂無有餘。
translation: "All sentient beings are quiescent in nature, and there's never been anything that has attained their root. If someone could contemplate this teaching, I'd say it's permanently quiescent without remainder.

source_sentence: 過去諸佛百千萬，　　度諸眾生無有盡，　而此眾生無真實，　　究竟寂靜更不生。
translation: There are a hundred million buddhas of the past who saved sentient beings without limit, but these sentient beings are unreal, and their ultimate quiescence doesn't arise.

source_sentence: 一切諸法皆滅相，　　未曾能有得生者，　若有能觀如是法，　　彼人不著於三界。
translation: All things in the world are in their aspect of cessation, and there's never been anyone who's been born, but if someone can contemplate such a thing, they won't be attached to the three realms.

source_sentence: 我說諸道無障礙，　　能離諸著甚可樂，　於百千劫甚難得，　　乃從往昔然燈佛，　能起最勝無生忍，　　永斷障礙無有餘，　得清淨念以為命，　　永離一切諸非見。
translation: I say that the paths are unobstructed, that it's pleasant to be free of attachments, that it's difficult to attain for a hundred thousand eons, and that it's from the past when Randana Buddha was able to produce the most excellent patient acceptance of nonarising, permanently eliminating obstacles without remainder, attaining pure mindfulness for life, and permanently parting with all wrong views.

source_sentence: 彼無惡趣常安樂，　　勇猛能知無礙法，　不著諸行得解脫，　　於百千劫不生畏，　能得諸辯亦不難，　　無邊百千陀羅尼，　解陀羅尼諸義趣，　　速能覺知無礙法。」
translation: He has no evil destinies and is always comfortable, is bold and able to know the unhindered Dharma, isn't attached to practices and attains liberation, doesn't become frightened during a hundred thousand eons, attains eloquence and isn't difficult, has unlimited hundreds of thousands of dhāraṇīs, understands the dhāraṇīs' meanings and destinies, and quickly perceives the unhindered Dharma."

source_sentence: 說是偈已，二百比丘增上慢者，不受諸法心得解脫；六十(丹云六千)菩薩得無生忍。
translation: After speaking this verse, 200 monks who were arrogant and conceited didn't accept the teachings and attained liberation, and 60 (Dan says 6,000) bodhisattvas attained the forbearance of nonarising.

source_sentence: 爾時，優波離白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Upāli then said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 當何名斯經，云何奉持？」
translation: What will be the name of this sūtra, and how will it be adhered to?"

source_sentence: 佛告優波離：「此經名為『決定比尼』，亦名『壞一切心識』，當奉持之。」
translation: The Buddha told Upāli, "This sūtra is called 'Definitive Vinaya,' and it's also called 'Destroying All Minds and Consciousnesses,' so you should memorize it."

source_sentence: 爾時，優波離、文殊師利，一切大會，諸天、世人、阿修羅等，聞佛所說，皆大歡喜，為佛作禮。
translation: It was then that Upāli, Mañjuśrī, the entire assembly, gods, humans, asuras, and others who heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced greatly and paid homage to him.

source_sentence: 佛說決定毗尼經
translation: The Sutra of the Determinate Vinaya Spoken by the Buddha
